pair.Response:
Prompt: Northern Securities Co. v. United States (1903)
Response: In this case, the Supreme Court affirmed the decree of the lower court, holding that Congress has the power to regulate interstate and international commerce, including the power to declare certain combinations illegal. The Court further held that the Anti-Trust Act of 1890 was a valid exercise of this power, and that it was applicable to the combination of competing railroad companies in this case.
